properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 13 at 9:46AM EST until February 14 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC
has issued a Flood Advisory for the French Broad River Near Fletcher
affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties...

Runoff from the early morning heavy rainfall will likely cause the river
to crest just below flood stage.

The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a
* Flood Advisory for the French Broad River Near Fletcher.
* through Friday morning.
* At 8 AM Thursday the stage was 10.0 feet.
* Action Stage is 10.0 feet.
* Minor Flood Stage is 13.0 feet.
* FORECAST: The river will rise to near 11.5 feet by early Friday
morning.
* IMPACTS: At 11.5 feet: Butler Bridge Rd. is inundated with up to 6
inches of floodwaters, forcing road closure.
* IMPACTS: At 10.0 feet: The river exceeds bankfull at the gauge site.
Isolated farmland flooding is beginning from Etowah downstream to
Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory for a river forecast point means that nuisance
flooding is expected to occur along the river when the river level is
forecast to be just below or at the official flood stage.
